LanguageData.WB_CustomizeSaveMapAll: Save to all {0} present on map
LanguageData.WB_UnsavedChangesWarning: You have unsaved changes. Are you sure you want to close without saving?
LanguageData.WB_CustomizeDetailTabExplanation: Write the details of this thing.
LanguageData.WB_CustomizeNarrativeTabExplanation: Write a narrative for this thing. This can be read using the "view narrative" button.
LanguageData.WB_CustomizeViewNarrativeDesc: View the narrative text for this item.
LanguageData.WB_CustomizeSaveToPresetConfirm: Save current customization for {0} as the default for the '{1}' world?
LanguageData.WB_CustomizePresetSaveSuccess: Customization default for {0} saved to world '{1}'.
LanguageData.WB_CustomizePresetSaveFailed: Failed to save customization default for {0} to world '{1}'.
LanguageData.WB_SettingsResetPlayerDefaultsConfirm: Are you sure you want to reset all player default customizations? This cannot be undone.
LanguageData.WB_SettingsResetNeedsSave: You need to be inside a save for this to function.
LanguageData.WB_SettingsNoPresetsToDelete: No user-created worlds available to delete.
LanguageData.WB_SettingsConfirmDeletePresetMessage: Are you sure you want to permanently delete the world '{0}' and all associated data (images, etc.)? This cannot be undone.
LanguageData.WB_SettingsResaveWorldDesc: Resave the current world preset data.
LanguageData.WB_SettingsShowGizmoThingsDesc: Checkbox for if customize gizmo should be shown on things
LanguageData.WB_SettingsShowGizmoPawnsDesc: Checkbox for if customize gizmo should be shown on pawns
LanguageData.WB_SettingsShowGizmoPlayerColony: Show customize button on player colony
LanguageData.WB_SettingsShowGizmoPlayerColonyDesc: Checkbox for if customize gizmo should be shown on player colonies
LanguageData.WB_SettingsShowGizmoFactionBases: Show customize button on faction bases
LanguageData.WB_SettingsShowGizmoFactionBasesDesc: Checkbox for if customize gizmo should be shown on faction bases
LanguageData.WB_SettingsShowGizmoMapMarkers: Show customize button on map markers
LanguageData.WB_SettingsShowGizmoMapMarkersDesc: Checkbox for if customize gizmo should be shown on map markers
LanguageData.WB_DefaultPresetDescription: Rimworlds are diverse worlds lacking in strong central government and low in population density. Because theyâ€™re not homogenized by a central government, they tend to see a lot of interaction between people of different technology levels, as travelers crash-land or ancient communities stumble out of their cryptosleep vaults. These planets are often at the rim of known space, hence the name. \n\nThe classic Rimworld experience.
LanguageData.WB_PlanetTypeLabel: What type of planet type would you call this? (ex: Rimworld, Animalworld)
LanguageData.WB_DifficultyLabel: How difficult is your world to survive in?
LanguageData.WB_WorldSettingsSaveFactionsTooltip: Save the list of factions currently enabled in the save game.
LanguageData.WB_WorldSettingsSaveIdeologiesTooltip: Save all details of NPC ideologies present on the planet.
LanguageData.WB_WorldSettingsSaveTerrainTooltip: Save all planet features, including rivers, roads, and the seed.
LanguageData.WB_WorldSettingsSaveBasesTooltip: Save details of all faction settlements, including name, description, narrative, and placement.
LanguageData.WB_WorldSettingsSaveMapMarkersTooltip: Save custom map markers placed by the player.
LanguageData.WB_WorldSettingsSaveMapTextTooltip: Save custom map text labels placed by the player.
LanguageData.WB_WorldSettingsSaveStorykeeperEntriesTo: Save narrative entries made in the storykeeper log.
LanguageData.WB_WorldSettingsSaveWorldTechLevelToolti: If enabled, the world's tech level will be saved with this world.
LanguageData.WB_WorldSettingsIdeologyRequiredMsg: Ideology has been enabled as it is required for this option.
LanguageData.WB_WorldSettingsFactionsRequiredMsg: Factions have been enabled as they are required for this option.
LanguageData.WB_PawnCustomizeSaveToAllConfirm: Save current customization to all pawns of kind '{0}' on all maps?
LanguageData.WB_PawnCustomizeSaveToAllSuccess: Customization applied to {0} pawns of kind '{1}'.
LanguageData.WB_PawnCustomizeSaveDefaultToPresetConfi: Save current appearance and narrative as the default for {0} in the '{1}' world? (Name and description will not be saved)
LanguageData.WB_PawnCustomizeDefaultPresetSaveSuccess: Appearance/narrative default for {0} saved to world '{1}'.
LanguageData.WB_PawnCustomizeDefaultPresetSaveFailed: Failed to save appearance/narrative default for {0} to world '{1}'.
LanguageData.WB_PawnCustomizeSaveMapAll: Save to all {0} on current map
LanguageData.WB_PawnCustomizeResetNeedsSave: You need to be inside a save for this to function.
LanguageData.WB_CreateWorldParamsConfirmUnlockSeedMes: Are you sure you want to change the seed? This world preset has defined terrain, and changing the seed will result in a different world being generated than intended by the preset.
LanguageData.WB_GizmoCustomizeColonyDesc: Open the customization menu for this colony.
LanguageData.WB_FactionIconSharedWarning: Multiple factions of this type exist. Due to technical limitations, the icon will be shared by all factions of this type.
LanguageData.WB_TileOccupied: This tile is already occupied by another settlement.
LanguageData.WB_GizmoAddMarkerDesc: Add a custom marker to this tile.
LanguageData.WB_MapEditorTerrainPropertiesNote: Other terrain properties are determined by seed of map once painted onto new tiles.
LanguageData.WB_MapEditorLandmarkInvalidTile: Landmark {0} cannot be placed on this tile type.
LanguageData.WB_TransitionWorldExplanation: This will allow you to change your world into another world. This will only affect things that a player used the "save to world" button on like visual aesthetics, labels, etc. But obviously won't affect anything that you have setup in the world creation menu, like terrain, enabled factions, etc.
LanguageData.WB_MapTextInvalidPosition: Invalid position. Please enter a valid position.
LanguageData.WB_CreatePresetOverwriteConfirm: Creating a world with the name {0} will overwrite the existing world. Are you sure you want to continue?
LanguageData.WB_OpenStoryLibraryDesc: Open the storykeeper to view and manage entries.
LanguageData.WB_StoryEditorDeleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this story? This cannot be undone.
LanguageData.WB_ConfirmDeleteSettlement: Are you sure you want to delete {0}? This action cannot be undone.
LanguageData.WB_RemoveFactionWarning: Are you sure you want to remove {0}? This will erase the faction and all its settlements. Only do this before real gameplay starts.
LanguageData.WB_ThingCustomizeSaveFactionDefaultConfi: Are you sure you want to save as player faction default? This will apply these customizations to all future player-owned {0} and all existing player-owned {0}.
LanguageData.WB_ThingCustomizeNoFactionDefault: No player faction default set for {0}.
LanguageData.WB_ThingCustomizeSaveMapAllConfirm: Are you sure you want to save this customization to all instances of {0} on the current map?
LanguageData.WB_WorldbuilderResaveSuccess: Worldbuilder: Successfully resaved world data to preset '{0}'.
LanguageData.WB_WorldbuilderResaveFailed: Worldbuilder: Failed to resave world data to preset '{0}'. Check logs.
LanguageData.WB_WorldbuilderNoPresetToResave: Worldbuilder: No world preset loaded to resave to.
LanguageData.WB_SavePlanetGenParams_Tooltip: Save current planet generation settings (biomes, terrain, climate, etc.) to this world preset. Seed is excluded.
LanguageData.WB_DisableUndefinedBiomes_Tooltip: If enabled, any biomes not defined in this preset will have their commonality set to 0, preventing them from spawning.
LanguageData.WB_XenotypeTotalError: Total xenotype commonality must sum to 100%.
LanguageData.WB_PopEditor_XenotypeSaveWarning: Values must add up to 100%. Click save to confirm.
LanguageData.WB_PopEditor_DisablePreferencesDesc: This will force the faction to not care about memes and precepts.
LanguageData.WB_PopEditor_ForceXenotypeDesc: This will force xenotypes onto pawn types that already have defined xenotypes. This means potentially breaking intended design, but will let you customize xenotypes to a greater extent.
LanguageData.WB_RiverEditModeEntered: River editing mode: {0}. Left-click to draw, right-click to cancel or delete rivers, ESC to cancel.
LanguageData.WB_RoadEditModeEntered: Road editing mode: {0}. Left-click to draw, right-click to cancel or delete roads, ESC to cancel.
LanguageData.WB_FileSyncingDescription: Note: This will save all changes to this narrative to an external file of your choosing on your computer. This is useful for organizing written narratives about your world, but the information the game uses to store this narrative will be kept in Rimworld's file structure instead, with this sync only serving as a copy.
LanguageData.WB_NarrativeSyncFailed: Failed to sync file. Check log.
